summary: My Dawnguard Crossbow Overhaul provides detailed and lore friendly retextures and recolours of Dawnguard DLC's crossbows, bolts and quivers.
descriptionHtml:
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/Yu3zat2l.jpg[/IMG]

About the Mod

My Dawnguard Crossbow Overhaul provides detailed and lore friendly retextures and recolours of Dawnguard DLC's crossbows, bolts and quivers.

I will provide several new texture variants for the standard and Dwarven crossbow so stay tuned and track this mod for updates if you are interested in my work.

Version 1.0 :

It includes a highly detailed retexture and recolour of the Dwarven crossbow, bolt and quiver which enhances this formidable weapon with tempered steel parts and works out the little details of this fantastic model. Its colour scheme fits well with Cabal's fantastic amb Dwarven set.

If you use an ENB configuration with reflections enabled you can enhance its metallic shimmer even further.

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/an2bg1el.jpg[/IMG]


Version 2.3 :

This version adds my main edition of the Steel crossbow, bolt and quiver which features new detailed wood textures and shiny silver inlays on the decorative metal parts.

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/UPgTOXfl.jpg[/IMG]

Version 2.2 :

Version 2.2 introduces my first themed variant "Vampire's Bane" with black wood and silverized metal. A fitting quiver and silver bolts are included too. I think this version is a good fit for a Demon Hunter, Assassin, Nightingale or even a Vampire.

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/iOaOVoal.jpg[/IMG]
Vampire's Bane by Seren4xx

All textures have been thoroughly compressed and are at about the size of the Beth HD DLC textures for maximum compatibility and performance.

About the looks of it images can say more than thousand words of mine - especially since I had the honour to be able to get some of the greatest screenarchers on the Nexus as beta testers for my work. Be sure to check out their remarkable work in the gallery on this front page and in the image section of this mod.


Video Review

[youtube]8DYSPz9YfqI[/youtube]
by Brodual


Requirements

Skyrim 1.8+ is required for this mod to work as well as the Dawnguard DLC. As a pure texture replacer this contains no ESP file.


Installation

Download the mod file and extract the file into your skyrim directory, e.g. C:Program Files (x86)SteamSteamAppscommonskyrimData and say "yes" when being asked to integrate and override.


Un-installation

Delete the file via NMM or manually by deleting the files contained in the mod folder within your Skyrim "Textures" folder.

Credits

Credits go to...

- Bethesda for creating the gaming masterpiece Skyrim, Dawnguard DLC and the HD texture packs
- Professor Tolkien who made a fact-loving lawyer and historician believe in magic again, the day I discovered his unique and ever outstanding work back in 2001
- Peter Jackson and WETA Workshop for being a great inspiration for this mod
- Lana del Rey, Howard Shore, Harry Gregson-Williams, Richard Wagner, Giacomo Puccini and others for helping me through endless hours of modding work

and last but absolutely not least to my fantastic group of beta testers :

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/705688]Seren4xx[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/1784046]netherwalk[/url]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/259193]SydneyB[/url]

The gallery on this front page is a tribute to YOU and your contribution, your friendly help and encouragement and as well to your inspiring and outstanding screenarchery work. THANK YOU SO MUCH!


Permissions

You are not allowed to use any assets of this mod whithout my permission.

Gallery

Now, after so much reading you really deserve the visual joyride provided by my wonderful Beta testers. Be sure to check out their other work here on the Nexus ( links to their work can be found in the "Credits" section. Enjoy it!

Author's note :

If you like this mod please take a second to show your apprechiation, leave a comment or load up a picture - I'd be really grateful for it, since I have put many hours of work and a lot of determination into it. If you enjoy a mod a few clicks should not be too much to ask for. If you face any issues please let me know, so that we may find a solution.
